intro: Tanacetum alyssifolium, commonly known as smallleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to cream-colored flowers that are arranged in flat-topped clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Tanacetum alyssifolium is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
